title: Small fixes for KiCad projects
body:
First of all: thanks @StuckAtPrototype for the project!

I'm thinking about building this and I was looking at the KiCad projects. There are a few minor improvements that I want to propose here:

- Some changes probably due to editing with newer KiCad version (8.0.5)
- Fixed schematic filename referenced in `racer.kicad_pcb`
- Add `.gitignore` for KiCad projects
- Fix values of some resistors in the PCB file (sync with schematic). This is especially relevant as some PCB manufacturers take the KiCad PCB file and use it for creating a BOM to source parts for assembly, etc.
author: fschrempf

comments.body: Thanks! I will start the review tomorrow night
Awesome, sorry for the long wait and thanks @andistorm for the review. I just double checked, everything looks good on my end. merging it in and thanks @fschrempf for the changes!

title: Circuit boards
body:
Are there only services that will allow me to have one the PCB printed with all of the electrical components in place? Are all of the files available for this project that would be needed for such a service?

I have no idea about how to make the final circuit board with everything soldered in place, but I would like to try and build this project.

I'm a software guy with some ESP32 programming experience
author: smebberson

comments.body: Everything necessary is within the repo, that said, I will generate placement files which will make it much easier. I am happy that you want to build it! I would love to see it once you are done :) Also, feel free to open a thread in the discussions if you need any help! thanks for the support

title: enable discussions in github
body: Not everyone wants to write an "issue". Some just want to discuss about features or so. So please activate the discussion tab in the project settings.
author: mars3142

comments.body: Enabled! Thanks for pointing this out. I actually did not know Github now has discussions! this is awesome!
